Class CheckersTextConsole

java.lang.Object
core.CheckersLogic
ui.CheckersTextConsole
public class CheckersTextConsole extends CheckersLogic
Version:
0.6 Apr 25, 2024 CheckersTextConsole represents the game UI for a Checkers game. This class handles interaction with the use methods for .
Author:
Alex Ishchenko

  • Constructor Details

    • CheckersTextConsole

      public CheckersTextConsole()
      Class constructor. Starts the game right away by calling the startGame() method

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Main method for the overall UI handling. Calls gameStatus() to ask user if he/she is willing to play the game.

    • tryToMove

      public int tryToMove(String player)
      tryToMove is the front side of checkPiece in CheckersLogic. This method handles input of the user, splits it into an appropriate way so it can be used further. Then it calls the checkPiece method to try and make the move. If the checkPiece output is something other than 1 (1 indicating a successfull move), then it outputs an error message corresponding to the error index and tryies
      Parameters:
      player - represents players index (either X or O)
      Returns:
      1 in case of success or 0 in case of failure, indicating then that player X has to try again
      Throws:
      Exception - that may occur due to an invalid output, or the wrong cell index.

    • convertStrToInt

      public int convertStrToInt(String str)
      Converts given column to the appropriate int value from 1 to 8
      Parameters:
      str - represents column value
      Returns:

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard()
      Iterates though each row and column of the board to print it. Also prints each rows number and column name

    • gameStatus

      public boolean gameStatus()
      Asks user if he's willing to play the game
      Returns:
      true in case user is willing to play/continue playing
